title: Implicit Tangent Line Explorer
description: Interactive simulation for exploring tangent lines to curves defined by implicit equations, demonstrating implicit differentiation with circles, ellipses, hyperbolas, and the Folium of Descartes.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Implicit Differentiation
Tangent Lines
Conic Sections
Implicit Curves

controls.label: Curve Selection
controls.description: Select the implicit curve to explore

controls.label: Point on Curve
controls.description: Click and drag the point along the curve to see tangent line updates

controls.label: Parameter 1
controls.description: Adjust the first curve parameter (e.g., radius r, semi-axis a)

controls.label: Parameter 2
controls.description: Adjust the second curve parameter (e.g., semi-axis b) when applicable

controls.label: Show Normal Line
controls.description: Toggle visibility of the normal (perpendicular) line

controls.label: Show Steps
controls.description: Toggle visibility of implicit differentiation steps

controls.label: Random Point
controls.description: Move the point to a random location on the curve

visualElements: Info panel with coordinates and slope
